feedback.question: What features of the product are most important to you?
feedback.results: The respondents generally valued flexibility and automation in the product. They appreciated flexible terms, automated savings plans, and savings challenges with rewards to help keep them motivated towards achieving goals. A competitive interest rate was also important to them. Additionally, financial education resources were seen as helpful tools to make informed decisions about managing finances. These features seemed to be common and very important to most respondents, especially those in professions related to technology, marketing, or entrepreneurship.

feedback.question: How frequently would you use this product?
What potential barriers do you see to using this product?
feedback.results: Potential barriers to using the proposed product include: high fees, high minimum deposit requirements, uncompetitive interest rates, complicated or time-consuming setup processes, difficulty or lack of flexibility in withdrawing funds, reliance on automated transfers, penalties for frequent withdrawals, lack of motivation from savings challenges and rewards, and preference for more traditional savings accounts. These barriers seem to be prevalent and important in the responses, indicating that they should be addressed in order to attract new members and expand deposit products. Overall, customers are looking for user-friendly, flexible products with competitive returns, transparent fees, and engaging savings challenges and education resources.

feedback.question: Would you be more likely to use this product if it had a rewards program?
feedback.results: Most survey respondents indicated that they would be more likely to use the product if it had a rewards program, with many emphasizing the importance of meaningful and relevant rewards. Challenges and milestones were also noted as motivators for some participants, along with the desire for recognition of achievements. Additional bonuses such as cashback or discounts on other products or services were also mentioned as enticing incentives. Overall, creating an attractive rewards program appears to be a popular and effective way to encourage users to save more and achieve their financial goals.

feedback.question: On a scale of 1-10, how important is the interest rate for this product to you?
What benefits do you see in this product that are not offered by other financial institutions?
feedback.results: The responses generally show that the standout features of the product that are not offered by many other financial institutions include unique savings challenges and rewards, financial education resources such as webinars and articles, penalty-free withdrawals once per year, flexible terms and rollovers into new savings plans. Savings challenges and rewards were often mentioned as a benefit that sets this product apart from others in the market and helps keep consumers motivated. Other cited benefits include financial education resources, penalties and withdrawal options that offer more flexibility to members than traditional savings accounts. Overall, the combination of these unique features appear to set the product apart and could be attractive to potential members.

feedback.question: Would you be more likely to use this product if there was a mobile app available?
feedback.results: The majority of respondents stated that they would be more likely to use the product if there was a mobile app available. Many individuals, particularly those with software engineering or development backgrounds, cited the convenience of accessing their account information and managing their savings on-the-go as a key factor in their decision. Having the ability to set up automated transfers, participate in savings challenges, and access financial education resources from their phone was also mentioned as important. Analysts rated the importance of a mobile app for the product as a 9 and an 8 out of 10, respectively.

feedback.question: On a scale of 1-10, how likely are you to recommend this product to a family member?
